lexUnit.name: orbit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the regularly repeated elliptical course of a celestial object or spacecraft about a star or planet.

sentence.text: Kepler published his discovery of the elliptical orbits of planets in 1609 .
Mercury , the innermost planet , follows an elliptical orbit at a mean distance of 58 million km from the Sun .
Aristotle thought that the earth was stationary and that the sun , the moon , the planets , and the stars moved in circular orbits about the earth .
The pulsar is in a very short period , circular orbit .

The US operates five weather craft , three in geostationary orbit above the equator while the other two cover the whole globe .
